overview_of_class: Evolution of the Earth's dynamic system and its record through geological time. How the geological time scale was discovered will be described. Emphasis of the course is on the evolution of life as determined from the evidence of the fossil record.
name: Earth System History
title: WCAS EARTH 203-0-01 Earth System History
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Registration is reserved for EARTH majors & minors and ENVR_SCI majors & minors.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Evolution of the Earth's dynamic system and its record through geological time. How the geological time scale was discovered will be described. Emphasis of the course is on the evolution of life as determined from the evidence of the fossil record.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Registration preference will be given to first-year and sophomore students. If you're unable to enroll in the course, please sign up on our departmental waitlist here: ____. Please be advised: We do not use the Caesar waitlist for this course. In order to be considered, you must fill out the departmental waitlist at this link.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Understanding of geological time, paleontology, and the importance of fossils is the main emphasis of the course.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Earth System History, Steven M. Stanley, W. H. Freeman, 4th edition, 2014, ISBN-13: 978-1-4292-5526-4. The 3rd edition, available on the Internet, is also acceptable.
